titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid to Dyke TV records SSC.MS.00656

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-12-03 15:37:33 -0500.

change.item: This resource was modified by the ArchivesSpace Preprocessor developed by the Harvard Library (https://github.com/harvard-library/archivesspace-preprocessor)
This record was migrated from InMagic DB Textworks to ArchivesSpace.
This finding aid was updated to reflect accurate copyright ownership and that donor has agreed for video to be published on open internet.

did.unittitle: Dyke TV records
did.abstract: Television production company; Lesbian business. Collection includes video tapes, raw footage, and DVD dubs for Dyke TV programs. The materials cover a wide range of topics, including but not limited to lesbians in sports, artists, gay pride, childhood and coming of age stories, political issues, gay and lesbian civil rights, sexuality, lesbian parenting, HIV/AIDS and other health issues, incest survivors, lesbian domestic violence, and women's rights. [NOTE: The contents list for this collection is not online. Contact the Sophia Smith Collection if you would like one sent to you.]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for use without restriction beyond the standard terms and conditions of Smith College Special Collections.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Further additions to the collection were made on 2018 April 23 and 2018 July 17, under Accessions 2018-S-0026 and 2018-S-0043.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Dyke TV Records were donated to the Sophia Smith Collection by producers Sally Sasso and Mary Patierno in 2009.

altformavail.head: Additional Formats
altformavail.p: Selected Dyke TV episodes and the complete show logs have been digitized and are available to view online.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Dyke TV was created by Ana Maria Simo (playwright and co-founder of Lesbian Avengers), Linda Chapman (theater director and producer) and Mary Patierno (independent film and video maker). The first show aired in New York City, June 8, 1993. Dyke TV produced national documentary television programming, by and for lesbians, designed to empower and to enhance the visibility of diverse lesbian communities; it mixed art, news, sports, political commentary, health coverage, music, and video as it examined issues of lesbian culture. The program reached over 6.5 million households nationwide, and was screened at many national and international film and music festivals. The half-hour weekly cable television show featured a five-minute news segment covering issues relevant to lesbian lives from a lesbian perspective; an in-depth look at an issue of particular interest to the lesbian community, including such topics as the International Dyke March at Stonewall 25, the murder of Brandon Teena, Camp Sister Spirit under siege, lesbians in the military, domestic partnership, and state-wide ballot initiatives and other anti-lesbian and anti-gay activities of the Christian Right; and interviews with lesbian artists, showcasing their work. Dyke TV won a Hometown Video Festival Award in 1994.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: As a preservation measure, researchers must use digital copies of audiovisual materials in this collection. Please consult with Special Collections staff to request the creation of and access to digital copies. Viewing copies of most final broadcast shows are available.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please use the following format when citing materials from this collection:
Dyke TV Records, Sophia Smith Collection, SSC.MS.00656, Smith College Special Collections, Northampton, Mass.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The original arrangement and folder titles were retained in most cases; moldy tapes quarantined.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Additional Dyke TV materials were donated to the Lesbian Herstory Archives, Brooklyn, NY

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records contain show master tapes, editor's master tapes, raw footage, and DVD dubs for Dyke TV programs. The materials cover a wide range of topics, including but not limited to lesbians in sports, artists, gay pride, childhood and coming of age stories, political issues, gay and lesbian civil rights, sexuality, lesbian parenting, HIV/AIDS and other health issues, incest survivors, lesbian domestic violence, and women's rights.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: To the extent that they own copyright, Sangfroid LLT (the production company that created Dyke TV) has retained copyright in works donated to Smith College. Copyright in other items in this collection may be held by their respective creators. For reproductions of materials that are governed by fair use as defined under U. S. Copyright Law, no permission to cite or publish is required. For those few instances beyond fair use, or which may regard materials in the collection not created by Sangfroid LLT, researchers are responsible for determining who may hold materials' copyrights and obtaining approval from them. Researchers do not need anything further from Smith College Special Collections to move forward with their use.

did.unittitle: Dyke TV records addition

physdesc.extent: (10 records cartons and three bags of moldy tapes)

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Twenty-one moldy tapes removed from boxes 6, 7, and 10 and placed in in quarantine (3 bags) West St. Basement 195 C 3-4 (as boxes 6a, 7a, and 10a)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records contain show master tapes, editor's master tapes, raw footage, and DVD dubs for Dyke TV programs. Also included are meeting notes, financial records, and fundraising materials. The materials cover a wide range of topics, including but not limited to lesbians in sports, artists, gay pride, childhood and coming of age stories, political issues, gay and lesbian civil rights, sexuality, lesbian parenting, HIV/AIDS and other health issues, incest survivors, lesbian domestic violence, and women's rights.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Mary Patierno, Dyke TV co-creator.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The original arrangement and folder titles were retained in most cases; moldy tapes quarantined and not yet thoroughly inventoried.

did.unittitle: Moldy video tapes

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: 21 moldy video tapes removed from boxes 6,7, and 10--put into quarantine as boxes 6a, 7a, and 10a, all in plastic bags in West St Basement 195 C 3 and 4.

did.unittitle: Dyke TV records further addition

physdesc.extent: (2 record cartons and 1 full letter document box)
(7 moldy boxes; quarantined in bags until further assessment is possible and thus not inventoried.)

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Materials have been held by Mary Patierno, Dyke TV co-creator, since the time that Dyke TV was disbanded.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include video tapes of Dyke TV episodes and content, as well as photographs and slides of content and production. Also includes financial documents, incorporation information, job descriptions for various positions, advertisements, and programming.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessible tapes were organized. Original folders and labeling were retained, with some additional organization. Moldy tapes and materials were quarantined.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: CDs in Box 2 and floppy disc in Box 3 have been flagged for digital archivist.
Boxes with moldy contents were quarantined for further assessment and those not inventoried.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: This content was received from the donor in digital form and is not currently available online. Please consult with Special Collections staff to request access.

Note on file formats: contents consists of Mac desktop publishing software files from 1995 (Quark file format). Special Collections is not able to provide the required software or system specifications for this file format.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The contents of the floppy disk was copied to networked storage for preservation.
